title.narrative: BEHAVIOUR CHANGE AND Open Defecation Free (ODF) COMMUNITIES

description.narrative: Communities in UNICEF selected counties that adopt ODF-free and good hygiene practices, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved, equitable and sustainable use of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) service and facilities Guinea Worm endemic areas, schools and health facilities as well as underserved communities.

participating-org.narrative: STATE MINISTRY OF SOCIAL DEVELOPMEN CULTURE YOUTH AND SPORT

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities in UNICEF selected counties that adopt ODF-free and good hygiene practices

description.narrative: During January 2014 to June 2016, 132,791 additional people benefited from safe sanitation facilities in CLTS-triggered and nearby villages and a total of 181 villages declared ODF. At least 50 per cent of households living in ODF communities have also access to handwashing facilities. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2015
